Geostorm

Movie |

Space Station | Artificial Intelligence

  • Release Date: 27 Oct 2017
  • Genre(s): Action, Science Fiction, Thriller
  • Language(s): English
  • Director(s): Suzanne Bingham, Sam Sullivan, Dean Devlin
  • Cast(s): Gerard Butler, Alexandra Maria Lara, Jim Sturgess, Abbie Cornish, Ed Harris See all Cast & Crew
  • Duration: 1h 49min
  • Music: Lorne Balfe,Sally Boldt,Richard Ziegler,Richard Bullock Jr.,Sean Heissinger
  • Award(s): ASCAP 2018 (Won)
    Imagen 2018 (Nominated) Awards List
  • Similar To: 65, Upgrade
  • Story:
    After an unprecedented series of natural disasters threatened the planet, the world's leaders came together to create an intricate network of satellites to control the global climate and keep everyone safe. But now, something has gone wrong: the system built to protect Earth is attacking it, and it becomes a race against the clock to uncover the real threat before a worldwide geostorm wipes out everything and everyone along with it.
    Full Story
5.3/10

Geostorm - IMAGE GALLERY

STORY AND RATINGS

Story
After an unprecedented series of natural disasters threatened the planet, the world's leaders came together to create an intricate network of satellites to control the global climate and keep everyone safe. But now, something has gone wrong: the system built to protect Earth is attacking it, and it becomes a race against the clock to uncover the real threat before a worldwide geostorm wipes out everything and everyone along with it.
Ratings

5.3/10

IMDb

TRIVIA AND POPULAR DIALOGUES

Trivia

Several cast and crew, even extras, noted that lead star/producer Gerard Butler did not appear to know many of his lines.

Jerry Bruckheimer was brought in to produce at a very late stage. The studio rejected the original cut due to poor reactions from test audiences. Extensive re-shoots, featuring new material written by Laeta Kalogridis, were helmed by Danny Cannon over two weeks, for a reported $15M.

Some of the NASA scenes were filmed at the NASA facility in New Orleans, LA.

Feature directorial debut of Dean Devlin.

Andy Garcia's daughter stars in this film with him (She plays Mickey).

Popular Dialogues

"Jake Lawson: [on Dutch Boy] This was my life's work, Max. You know, they said it was impossible, but we pulled it off. And it worked perfectly, without fail, day after day, year after year, so what do people do with it? Turn it into a gun."

"Leonard Dekkom: What the hell is Dutch Boy if not playing God? Ask Max. Science is all about playing God. Sometimes God doesn't play so nice. Max Lawson: You know what my brother would say? Leonard Dekkom: What? [Max punches Dekkom]"
